page.title: 06FULNECK SHOP
page.content: This was built in 1777 and has been a general store for the{Moravian {settlement}for many years. An early tenant was{J.Haley}as seen on the sign authorising the sale of snuff and tobacco. The present owner is{Mrs {Littlewood. The shop now serves as a tuck shop for the Schools and as a restaurant. Some evenings a{gourmet meal}is served.Also sold are lino-prints of Fulneck painted by local man {Norman {Carr}.The property is on lease and must remain a shop.Also if the business is to be sold it must have the church's approval. The interior has not changed much and some original items exist such as a unit of drawers used for herbs and spices.An adjoining guest-house was demolished in 1963.
